    • Constructor Detail

      • Server

        public Server(int commandPort,
      int videoPort,
      PololuCard card,
      CameraPreview cameraPreview)
       throws java.io.IOException
        Default constructor. It builds a Server instance and the ServerSockets. It creates 2 server sockets. One for receiving the commands, an other for sending the video stream. You need to call the start() method to really listen on the 2 created sockets.
        Parameters:
        commandPort - The port used to send the commands.
        videoPort - The port used to send the video stream.
        card - The Pololu card.
        cameraPreview - The camera Preview.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

    • Method Detail

      • close

        public void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Close the server.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • executeCommand

        public boolean executeCommand(java.lang.String[] fullCommand)
        Execute a command. The command is a string array where fullCommand[COMMAND] stands for the Pololu command, fullCommand[SERVO] represents the position of the servo, and fullCommand[VALUE] represents the new value.
        Parameters:
        fullCommand - an array that contains the command's elements.
        Returns:
        The command has been successfully sent to the pololu card.

      • getClientCommand

        public java.net.Socket getClientCommand()
        Returns:
        The client command socket.

      • getClientVideo

        public java.net.Socket getClientVideo()
        Returns:
        The client video socket.

      • init

        public void init()
          throws java.io.IOException
        Initialize the server. This step allows the server to close all open sockets.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Returns:
        Is the server running ?
